alert.note: Alert for Central Tularosa Basin; Sacramento Mountains Above 7500 Feet; West Slopes Sacramento Mountains Below 7500 Feet (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS El Paso (Southern New Mexico and extreme Western Texas)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 07 at 6:40PM MDT by NWS El Paso
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Otero County through 700 PM MDT... At 639 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 4 miles south of Alamogordo, moving north at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Alamogordo, Burro Flats, La Luz and Boles Acres. This includes the following highways... Highway 70 in New Mexico between mile markers 208 and 212. Highway 54 in New Mexico between mile markers 56 and 72. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Central Tularosa Basin; Sacramento Mountains Above 7500 Feet; West Slopes Sacramento Mountains Below 7500 Feet
